9B4E803A4C5A4FEDB0B0907D4B3C2740.description: To experience full participation of the Eucharist.

EE75739AD7484A80910CDA753BC2E811.description: To understand the importance of prayer, its purposes and various types of prayer.

E28B4A1CF9214C56ACBEB098D892C159.description: To identify how the Gospel affirms and challenges our thoughts and actions.

5583A9832DC04DB6830A2C38DD242D87.description: To examine our relationship with God in personal prayer.

BCD0DE614A164F10A688E885F13604EE.description:
The students will cultivate a prayer life; learn various forms of praying; be provided with experiences for
various forms of prayer.

3EC4268F07DC4299B7A851BEB6015864.description: To realize that Christian witness is expressed in loving concern for the poor.

FCA0E71DE95F47B9938B0B8034E34625.description: To realize their call to continue the growth of the life of the Church.

014C4BBEDB554272A1162377010E0A2C.description: To imitate Christ with a desire to imitate the saints' faith and actions.

112BE40F918F4065B9C6004DC0C0FB5A.description: To identify the role of the consecrated life.

DAA1C141F2944DD6AA58B42DC0787A65.description: List ways the laity can participate in their parish

2BDE99441D0446E49BE8A6D774A31F09.description: To identify the roll of laity in the Church.

7FB14DEEF2FA4C2B996944A18D600BA2.description: To identify the uniqueness of the priesthood.

341DE6332F014295A80797C22EEE1B11.description: To identify Christian vocations that reflect our baptismal call to descipleship.

901C780C6D0E4F3E98C98E0F4E2C38F7.description: The students will realize an understanding that as Catholic Christians, students have a responsibility to become actively involved in the mission of the Church as servant to the world.

DC7AE64FB986468384CCCE3E18612497.description:
respond with compassion and action to our needy brothers
and sisters globally

32F3128BFA3D4744B7DCEB4CFD5E0DB2.description:
To respond to the
challenge of world
hunger, poverty,
war/peace,
inequality,
discrimination, and
anti-life issues

6924F535E47E4318908642FC14CCB113.description:
To show how the
scriptural vision of
life encompasses
justice, peace,
equality and
stewardship

F7BED3ADB5384580BEC6C079716DEFE7.description: to know and live the Works of Mercy

A9D14E3CF282415F8FAA517286F9C4B4.description:
provide opportunities to accept responsibility and desire to
work for justice for all people

FB4F03D62C044A5C9845C04A1667246D.description:
To see action for
justice and peace as
an essential
characteristic of
Christianity

C481E1B845004412B38444A0A26B1C4B.description:
The students will become aware of the fact that they are members of a global community and share a
responsibility for each other’s well being.

BFFAC5804A8B4C64BA5E362D82D6007E.description:
actively make decisions that respect and protect the “gift of
sex” in self and others

3966838BB20647B8A1E2E29D33A3EC90.description:
students will become more aware of their duty to respect,
defend, preserve, and promote life

50EA1635130F4DD0BB765F09E0B7E791.description:
To identify moral
values in the
teachings of Christ.

3D50CE41ACAF40CE98DB512968D567F4.description: recognize opportunities for sacrifice and service

6767BBB5976E4C188406C765266A0BCF.description: know that faith is expressed by sacrifice and service

C09F57AF10004AF4AA18E2CE704AD748.description:
To demonstrate
the call to be faithful
to God’s love.

0465197F5E394EA5898E37651DC6D7F9.description: accept and appreciate chastity as a virtue

9971FFCBED23437C8F1C2CA09F4D07C0.description:
fully understand that a physically, intimate relationship is
to be respected and engaged when it is a sign of the
permanent commitment of marriage

D31944726F514524A9E479096AB977DA.description:
develop firm grasp of the Catholic Church’s teachings
concerning pro-life issues and resolve to be life-givers in
practical situations

07A76192B10548BF8B0F63FEDE7B4AF2.description:
practice moral discernment skills necessary for dealing
with the challenges of teenage years

463C4B9CC4734E4A8D7B3524F4141C27.description:
To recognize that
our human sexuality
is a gift from God.

C19B073B329E4AD09891E59BF5E3F6F9.description:
use the Commandments, virtues, Beatitudes, Gifts and
Fruits of the Holy Spirit, Precepts of the Church, etc as
aids to making moral decisions

1F659BAF965A460BB0CA87467F379A72.description:
recognize that the basis of moral decision-making within
the Catholic Church is conscience, sin, and Penance and
Reconciliation, prayer, examples of the saints and other
good Christians

C204FABC3E104363B945EF9C9228C07E.description:
To become more
aware that Christian
moral living is a
response to their
covenant with God.

8798E0D675A04AF98E45479E22D2A80B.description: list and define the theological virtues

26A05B5248E44BBCB8860A7750A7361F.description:
To identify the
theological virtues:
faith, hope, love.

DA20C23F8B204394B3F875A6A438B0D5.description: use the Beatitudes as guides for Christ-like living

D3E4C8A708B5463BBCBBF753BF609BD6.description: know that Jesus’ law of love must direct all of our actions

1BE965CE3BC8444EA31D91513F283425.description:
To identify moral
values in the
teachings of Jesus.

DFC5AC1AEA9546C583D15CBB141F7003.description:
understand that Jesus, in His humanity, was tempted by
Satan

DFED4E70C02E47B6A6C59A1B1C6D3A45.description: know that Jesus was like us in all ways but sin

A221923764BD4E3D9BF6AA9CB6BCF1F0.description:
To recognize that
the foundation of
Catholic morality is
based upon Christ’s
humanity.

618DF2C0208947C387AF643132F85998.description: The students will form their conscience according to the teachings of Scripture, Jesus, and the Church, so that they can make correct moral decisions. The students will cultivate a reverence for all of life and develop an understanding and respect for the physical, psychological, and spiritual aspects of sexuality.

C857F4EDB9EB461896C1DE09E809EB09.description:
appreciate that in receiving the Eucharist they become one
with Christ

C0A5C6F5136B4B30A473DE1FF938A003.description: imitate Jesus’ courage in the face of opposition

23B3A0A3C3724155A4AE3AFFD8F81F4E.description:
To be
empowered by
Christ to “do
everything God
asks.”

3FFE7D0DE11E499EB9462BD1A0C72839.description: determine how Jesus would react to current world problems

7877AA3914DA4EF68DCADA6F1490723D.description:
identify principles Jesus gave us to help and guide us
including the Beatitudes, the Golden Rule, His words and
actions during the Last Supper, and His example in many
situations as seen in Scripture

D44B386AFE6B49F9911E3B91EAC1D62D.description:
To examine the
teachings of Jesus
about God, prayer,
justice and peace,
service and moral
life.

2634A2F866FE415DA64422E0059A88A5.description:
identify the value of Christ with individuals of modern
times

E7852CF4F03648F088541BDEDE16A8F5.description:
explore Scripture and cite examples that teach us who is
Jesus

576A2326D8DE45C9A4488434DCBA6EB0.description:
To illustrate that
Scripture teaches us
about the person of
Jesus and what
following Jesus and
living the Good
News means.

80B30648E7104E00B59FDDA0D1C6D28A.description:
grow in appreciation of the Bible and desire to read and
pray through Scriptures

17615C01808C4B1981492DF108939D5B.description:
trace the birth of the Church and its growth through
Scripture searches of Acts of the Apostles and the epistles

82697AEEC6B6450C86F06A5A83516748.description:
identify Old Testament and New Testament as the two main
parts and explain each

5BA38F782DEC4A9283ACEE7183D6F1B8.description:
recognize the Bible as many books written under God’s
inspiration

E6F4F5E3FF24426082CC5FFD0E84EE20.description:
. To understand
that the Bible is the
inspired word of
God, which reveals
God, gives
knowledge of our
faith and contains a
personal message for
each person.

B840D1D1C5FC4ED799795D8E8B4ECB53.description: The students will develop an appreciation of the Scriptures as God’s inspired word.

B70C9A6FF48946D397CCEC3F6BC55A15.description:
To explain the
concept of
transubstantiation.

983D5DC51B6C41E09B89C86C3BF9C38C.description:
identify similarities and differences between the Last Supper
and the Eucharist

A27862BBB39348CEADC293BCA575D4E8.description:
relate Jesus’ Last Supper to the Passover celebration that it
was

E72F2E29E4AF4C71819A1B3438918448.description:
recall the events of Passover and the meal the Israelites were
instructed to eat

B577EF98B44A49EC999588F1A483DB79.description:
To compare and
contrast the
Eucharistic
celebration to the
Last Supper.

0BF6DC6CFF7C4EC9B71D00F17BBDFB6F.description:
model and instill a desire to receive the sacrament of Penance
and Reconciliation regularly and Eucharist often

9C053E2BDC86427B9AD940E3C904313C.description: list the sacraments and categorize them

1822AB6F8A2B471E92DA27CFE31C036E.description: know that the sacraments are a means to become holy

A8FABED2ADE74C57AF1DA31DCEA1C965.description:
the celebration of the Eucharist is the greatest prayer of the
Church

4584EA495DE240C79CA2412834ADBAAD.description:
To describe how
sacraments signify
and make present
God’s grace.

8EEF3A675FAF45E7939DF69BC4E7F924.description:
understand that each Mass is a celebration of the Paschal
Mystery

8A2545F2373D4203A80A9D489FFB5E19.description:
become more familiar with terms related to the liturgy:
vessels, vestments, books

3BC18098C6894BC38FB71C427E691521.description:
list the parts of the Mass in sequence and group them into the
major parts

9B795A5AC61741C790A75A651A9E3EB4.description:
understand the celebration of the Eucharist is the greatest
prayer of the Church

FBFC54B3E18A44F582406A9FC1A98153.description:
To identify the
four major parts of
the Mass/Eucharist:
Introductory Rite,
Liturgy of the Word,
Liturgy of the
Eucharist,
Concluding/Dismissal
Rite.

1A1C641D61D24B49A724455C16054AAE.description:
The students will develop an appreciation of and participation in the liturgical and
sacramental life of the Church.

90ADFD7AE6DA4EBB920988C1E86F2ABF.description:
recognize the theological and cardinal virtues as well as
 other virtues that develop through practice, helps us
 follow Christ to discover virtues listed in the New
 Testament

6323D3CED551488B8936246817814E41.description:
To realize what it
means to live a
Christian life

CDE02097D4AD477281DC33836310E03C.description:
identify heresies and related councils subsequent doctrines
confirmed by them

5B55E0EF6D324443BA2D844FFD6F1E39.description:
To appreciate the
contributions of the
Fathers of the
Church and
Ecumenical Councils

69D2EF0B65D7452CBFE48874766628E5.description:
develop respect for other religious denominations while
 remaining faithful to their own

C50F6DFD98E74855BD58D75D5039BE83.description:
identify and recognize who belongs to the
 Communion of Saints.

677424F59F0A4260B963829A49D69403.description:
To understand the
Church began with
God’s chosen people
and include all the
living and dead who
responded to God’s
love

9542CE404D8146C3A4FEEC2B7537F4E4.description:
search Scripture for examples of Jesus’ divinity and His
humanity

6BD7393552B54B4B90C80148F8A7D3CD.description:
To identify and
demonstrate ways in
which Jesus is both
God and human

F9D8539965584197A62F0C4FAF37CBAC.description:
read and summarize I Corinthians 6:18
-
20 to emphasize and 
learn that their bodies are the “temple
(s)
of the Holy Spirit” 
and 
H
e lives in them

15C8ED36B2904546AF0D22DD32DC80F0.description: list from Scripture the qualities of Christ that show H is spirituality and humanity

775C53FCC85948BE9375D1F7905A9C86.description: illustrate an understanding of the Holy Trinity

0C6B92EC502A428ABEF43394DFDDAEF9.description: To illustrate through Scripture that humankind was created in the Triune God’s image and likeness

A2956B0916984E93BAA35FCDC025D727.description: identify the main points of the Infancy Narratives

7D1A2F34B95544C8B7402F39B25641CC.description: know that the Infancy Narratives are contained in the Gospels of Matthew and Luke

21526A4C43994A49BB1B5CA3829C75CE.description:
know that the feast of Pentecost is celebrated 50 days after 
Easter

79C8292C999C412284CAF7D5AB23A676.description: explain the significance of wind and fire

97460FBD54084C8D8D072CCD35D6A8BB.description:
To recognize 
Pentecost as a 
celebration of the 
coming of the Holy 
Spirit to the disciples

9339EF34F8C24944B829A7AEB01A3B86.description: create a similar example to explain the Holy Trinity

E904121D1EDB492689C7A3D0DAECCDD2.description:
tell the story of Saint Patrick using a shamrock to explain 
the Trinity

79D7CFB2CD9C43069A91CEDBA14F50C3.description: To illustrate the Holy Trinity as one God the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit

C4D06A363D0949589D76D089CA5FB85F.description: know and pray prayers to the Holy Spirit

9F56568DA81A4BD2BAD72B1B29D23530.description: identify examples of the gifts and fruits being used by people they admire

0D4D5BACBBD3475DADCF96142D6C7524.description: list the gifts and fruits of the Holy Spirit

54E4896027F14E96B0A0343BF3DB8D40.description:
To examine and 
discuss ways we can 
let the Holy Spirit 
guide
our lives

3D3BF0E1E03A4BBCA914F8B2B2C55A6B.description: create a Powerpoint presentation based on Mary that includes such things as shrines dedicated to her, songs, feasts, prayers, and other traditions centered on her

D373618C82294B75BC899DBF300184BE.description: identify the Holy Days of Obligation that honor Mary

95DA5F4CE7D34798B44642F82B5A5707.description:
To show how 
Mary is 
recognized 
and 
honored by 
Catholics as the 
Mother of God

E110CB38776E42589AD03E80AE5DD5ED.description: list the truths contained in the creed in class

1BA0E778C793418EA3A1522EEC5B92BA.description: recite the Nicene Creed during Mass

A83F49BBF52C470DA14CF188B3C46223.description: To recall and explain the Nicene Creed

15FF600319A7488FB67FE2E0D7B06C17.description: The students will acquire knowledge of the doctrines of the Church in an age appropriate manner.

3B67BD83AE9A4CBAA5FDFD99E22E64B0.description: understand the three one - year cycles into which Sunday readings are divided

151343FCAC3C4C36B27D59956813EDAE.description: identify the Liturgy of the Hours as the official prayer of the Church

BD27584F58804AE2B4BC2D9B80AE99B1.description: list names and dates of Holy Days of Obligation

81695826463C4048AD0F63CF818A58F1.description:
retell the seasons of the liturgical year, associated colors of 
each season, and the related focus

CA2B5B942562479D8C966072C9B3E385.description:
To understand 
how the Church 
celebrates the whole 
mystery of Christ 
and honors Mary and 
the Saints

41AE9A03DBB143C7B060443A565C4DBF.description:
understand the spread of Catholicism in
America

027DA75F437242CCA1D8AE3DB2295C62.description: discuss and understand persecutions, schisms, crusades, 2. heresies, and the resulting councils, encyclical reformation, revolutions, etc.

22CDE319604E413ABA36DCAFF9578C90.description: To emphasize and retell that Catholic beliefs are sound and rooted in tradition of the Church

F5A3E48D58C34366ACC6EDC39CDF2BA8.description: Celebrate the birthday of the Church

813E1F13DE4D407EA9656B0791FF52DD.description: know that Pentecost is celebrated 50 days after Easter

543AF2DD89084AD9B54E14966E30ABE3.description:
tell the story of Pentecost and explain the significance of 
wind and fire

B3145DA6774940E1B810161888831862.description:
To recall that the 
Feast of Pentecost 
is 
the birth of the 
Church

1A076A0B68DA447FB5CAA5FEAAA5F79A.description:
compose a pledge to set a good example in showing 
unselfish concern for others

1E3C4724A4EB423F90EA497BFB6DD5DE.description: reflect upon their personal call to serve the Church and be Christ in the world today

885AFF1C141D4F859375B6F684E0A8A4.description: To explore the ministries of word, worship, community building,  and service as the continuation of Jesus' mission today.

BE42B152D435438BA7C4B87C1AA6F822.description: understand that Jesus' Resurrection gave meaning to His life and through it He showed Himself to be the Son of God and Savior.

1E0EF20A86B24E64BE9F74CB98FF7633.description: know that Jesus' Resurrection is the greatest event in the history of mankind.

64D0BE4396B44E6BB22FECC75BC8E857.description: To recognize the resurrection of Christ as the central event of the Church

983B392D34B047D5AFE9009947E1DC38.description:
recognize the universal character of the Church in order to
become more welcoming and accepting

042A41B797A747F4AEFC1977E7334508.description:
know the meaning of Scripture images and models of the
Church

259713FE4B9A40A9B420C76CF747E2AE.description:
follow the growth and spread of Christianity through
scripture; study the Acts and letters

2EDD1D91AF9143E9B340FF4148D6E4D3.description:
discuss the People of God as Church and
 the Body of Christ

75CA9E6F3E594FE1BE15ACEB3379E8EF.description:
To deepen
understanding and
appreciation of the
mystery of the
Church and the role
of the Holy Spirit

1F461502854E4A5E828D4C7692E9DB4A.description:
To instill in the students the understanding that the Church is “the people of God” on earth and
the sign of God’s presence in the world today.
